title: Tua calls out some Fins for meeting attendance
content: Dolphins quarterback Tua Tagovailoa said Sunday that some of his teammates are showing up late or not at all to player-led meetings.

title: 49ers lose top LB Warner to season-ending injury
content: The San Francisco 49ers took another significant injury hit Sunday when linebacker Fred Warner departed in the first quarter because of a season-ending dislocated and fractured right ankle.

title: Unbuckled: Dowdle backs up talk, rolls Cowboys
content: Ex-Cowboys RB Rico Dowdle backed up his trash talk against his former team, racking up a Panthers-record 239 scrimmage yards in a 30-27 victory.

title: L.A. to start Snell in Game 1, Ohtani later in NLCS
content: The Dodgers will start Blake Snell in Game 1 of the NLCS and Yoshinobu Yamamoto in Game 2, meaning Shohei Ohtani will only pitch one game.

title: Glenn defends Fields despite Jets' -10 pass yards
content: Quarterback Justin Fields received a strong vote of confidence from coach Aaron Glenn despite the worst passing performance in Jets history.

title: UAB fires coach Dilfer amid 2-4 start to 3rd season
content: UAB fired football coach Trent Dilfer on Sunday amid a 2-4 start to the season. Alex Mortensen will serve as interim coach.

title: Colts' Richardson has orbital fracture from mishap
content: Colts quarterback Anthony Richardson Sr. sustained an orbital fracture during pregame warmups and was inactive for his team's 31-27 victory over game the Cardinals.

title: Questions, takeaways from NFL Week 6: Raiders bounce back against Titans; Panthers and Chargers win thrillers
content: Our NFL Nation reporters answer the biggest questions out of each game. Here's what we learned from Week 6.

title: The rise of Curt Cignetti, the fall of James Franklin and other midseason thoughts
content: Bill Connelly looks at both ends of the coaching world, plus the top players, the Heisman race and more.

title: Penn State fires James Franklin: Top candidates, transfers and recruits
content: After two shocking losses, Penn State is looking for a new coach. The job quickly becomes the best in this cycle.

title: Week 6 winners and losers: Dowdle makes case to keep starting; time to sack Fields?
content: Rico Dowdle, Jaxon Smith-Njigba and De'Von Achane dazzled with big Week 6 performances, but several of fantasy's most reliable stars early this season had a down week.

title: Buzz: Dowdle stars again with 239 yards; Is Hubbard's starting job in jeopardy?
content: A look at what stood out from Sunday, including Rico Dowdle potentially shaking up Carolina's RB depth chart.

title: Who is going to the World Series? Expert predictions for ALCS, NLCS
content: The Dodgers, Brewers, Blue Jays and Mariners remain. Here's who we think will move on -- and how our playoff predictions have fared so far.

title: Latest matchups for every postseason game, from Celebration Bowl to national title
content: Texas A&M, Texas Tech, Georgia Tech -- and, of course, Indiana -- continue to surprise in the bowl picture.

title: Hamlin charges to emotional 60th Cup win
content: Denny Hamlin became the first driver to lock in a spot in NASCAR's championship-deciding finale, winning Sunday at Las Vegas Motor Speedway for his career-goal 60th Cup Series triumph.

title: Who is this year's Mr. October? Tracking the playoff leaders so far
content: We go inside the numbers to keep tabs on which players are doing the best job at helping their teams win.

title: Tuchel's tough love on Bellingham could help England and the player at World Cup
content: England boss Thomas Tuchel wants unity, humility and hunger, even if it means sidelining his biggest name -- Jude Bellingham -- for now.

title: Jaguars WR Travis Hunter takes part in life-changing event before Seahawks matchup
content: The Jacksonville Jaguars' two-way rookie took part in the life-changing decision at Celebration Church.

title: NFL draft risers, questions and notes: What did we learn about the QB class Saturday?
content: Has anyone emerged as the 2026 draft class' QB1 yet? We have notes and updates on NFL prospects through CFB Week 7.

title: The Broncos are a defensive-based team, and that's what they need to be right now
content: Sean Payton is known for his great offenses. But after another big day on the other side of the ball, he knows Denver has a defensive personality.

title: Patriots win third straight game thanks to Kayshon Boutte's big day
content: The WR had two TDs in a return to his home state. Now, New England is on to another homecoming in Tennessee.

title: Bettors back Bengals; Beck, Simpson, Mendoza new Heisman faves; Mayfield for MVP?
content: In Joe Flacco's debut with Cincinnati, the underdog Bengals attracted betting support then covered late vs. the Green Bay Packers.

title: Offseason questions for eliminated teams: What's next for Cubs after NLDS defeat
content: Here's how the winter looks in Chicago -- and in the other towns whose teams lost their final postseason game.

title: The three stars who made the Aces three-time WNBA champs
content: Las Vegas won on the shoulders of A'ja Wilson, Chelsea Gray and Jackie Young. The trio has no plans to stop.

title: Once a club on the rise, Liverpool in desperate need of a spark under Gareth Taylor
content: Gareth Taylor had a chance to rewrite the narrative of Liverpool's season against Manchester City, his former club. Instead, the Reds fell short once again.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Real Madrid targeting Chelsea's Enzo Fernández
content: Real Madrid are strengthening their pursuit of Chelsea's Enzo Fernández. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Tiger Woods injuries: Timeline of some of the injuries from Tiger's career
content: From 2007 to now, Tiger Woods has had a number of serious injuries. Here's a look at some of the more impactful ones, starting with an ACL and ending with a ruptured Achilles tendon.

title: Cheat sheet: 2025-26 NBA player rankings, schedule grid, more
content: Here is all of our key fantasy basketball draft content -- rankings, sleepers, schedule grid and draft tips -- collected into downloadable/printable PDF cheat sheets.

title: 'The war is over': Trump en route to Israel amid high-stakes truce deal; will Gaza ceasefire hold?
content: US President Donald Trump embarked on a significant trip to Israel and Egypt, heralding a ceasefire and hostage release deal that he declared has ended the Gaza war.  He expressed excitement for this "very special moment" and the "historic" peace efforts, anticipating a joint ceremony and chairing a Gaza peace summit with Egyptian PM al-Sisi.

title: 'If I didn't have tariffs ... ': Trump's latest remark on India-Pakistan conflict
content: US President Donald Trump claimed he resolved numerous long-standing global conflicts, including India-Pakistan disputes, by leveraging economic measures like tariffs. He stated this would be his eighth war ended, referencing the Gaza ceasefire. However, India has consistently rejected US intervention, asserting the India-Pakistan ceasefire was a result of direct military talks without third-party mediation.

title: Women's WC: Tough road ahead! Can India still make semis after back-to-back losses?
content: Hosts India face a challenging path in the ICC Women's ODI World Cup after consecutive defeats to Australia and South Africa. Despite being third in the points table, India's semi-final hopes hinge on crucial upcoming matches against England and New Zealand, requiring at least two wins from their remaining three fixtures.

title: Bengal YouTuber, teen son arrested for raping 15-yr-old girl
content: Investigators said father and son approached the Class 9 student several months ago with an offer to make shorts with her

title: Tech crash: Trump’s China tariffs causes $770 bn wipeout from Amazon, Nvidia, Tesla
content: Tech giants like Amazon, Nvidia, and Tesla faced a staggering $770 billion market value loss following President Trump's threat of 100% tariffs on China and export controls.  This significant downturn, the worst since April, also impacted the Nasdaq and S&P 500, with Bitcoin experiencing a sharp decline amidst the trade tensions.

title: Top stocks to buy: Recommendations for the week starting today - check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Motilal Oswal Financial Services has identified Delhivery and PN Gadgil as top stock picks for the week of October 13, 2025. Delhivery is experiencing strong festive momentum and network expansion, while PN Gadgil reported robust 2QFY26 performance driven by festive demand and strategic store additions.

title: Shocking! Nadeem’s mentor banned for life; blamed for Olympic champion’s poor show at Worlds
content: Pakistan Amateur Athletics Federation has imposed a lifetime ban on Salman Iqbal, coach of Arshad Nadeem, for violating Punjab Athletics Association constitution. The ban follows Iqbal's recent disclosures to the Pakistan Sports Board about the federation's lack of support for Nadeem's training and expenses.

title: Taiwan on China's rare earths curbs: Could affect global supply chains
content: Taiwan's economy ministry stated that China's new rare earth export restrictions will not disrupt the island's semiconductor industry. The controlled elements differ from those used in chip manufacturing, with Taiwan sourcing its needs from Europe, the US, and Japan. While the chip sector remains unaffected, China's curbs could impact global supply chains for electric vehicles and drones.

title: Women's WC: India vs Australia rewrites history - All the records broken
content: India and Australia's World Cup thriller shattered records. Smriti Mandhana achieved a monumental 5,000 WODI runs, becoming the youngest and fastest. Australia's Alyssa Healy led a breathtaking chase with a century, setting a new record for the highest successful run chase in women's ODIs. The match also saw a record number of sixes.

title: US' country cap on foreign students: Limit on UG cohorts; will India be hit?
content: The White House proposed a funding-linked compact to elite universities, including a double cap on international undergraduates. This policy limits international students to 15% of a campus's total undergraduate body and no more than 5% from any single country. The impact on Indian families is primarily felt in undergraduate admissions, as India's US.

title: Microsoft engineer quits after 13 years; sends resignation email to employees
content: A senior Microsoft engineer has resigned protesting the company's cloud contracts with the Israeli military. Scott Sutfin-Glowski cited enabling potential atrocities as his reason for leaving. This follows months of internal dissent and employee firings over Gaza-related demonstrations. Microsoft previously stopped some services to an Israeli intelligence unit after a report. However, many contracts remain active, and employee protests continue. Activists demand a complete cut of ties with Israel.

title: The Tomahawk ultimatum: Trump's warning shot to Moscow; Putin told to end war
content: US President Donald Trump has warned Russia that he might supply long-range Tomahawk missiles to Ukraine if the war isn't settled, a move that could significantly escalate pressure on Moscow. Trump conveyed this possibility after a "productive" call with Ukrainian President Zelenskyy, who sought enhanced long-range capabilities. This potential escalation follows Russia's attacks on Ukraine's power grid.

title: IND vs AUS: India lose despite 330! Why Harmanpreet blames batting, not bowling
content: India's captain Harmanpreet Kaur lamented a shocking lower-order collapse, where the team lost six wickets for 36 runs, costing them a potential 30-40 more runs. This proved decisive as Australia successfully chased a record 331. India openers Mandhana and Rawal providing a strong start but the middle and lower order failing to capitalise.

title: Report: Westbrook gets big China offer amid LeBron scapegoat buzz
content: Russell Westbrook, a free agent after his time with the Denver Nuggets, is reportedly considering a massive offer from an unnamed Chinese team. This deal is rumored to be quadruple what the Sacramento Kings could have offered. The move comes after Westbrook faced scapegoating during his tenure with the Los Angeles Lakers.

title: Drama! Pak skipper called 'India captain' during SA Test; video goes viral
content: During the Pakistan vs. South Africa Test, commentator Shaun Pollock mistakenly called Pakistan captain Shan Masood the "captain of India." This gaffe occurred as the crowd cheered for Babar Azam's arrival, anticipating his return after the Asia Cup 2025. Masood was later dismissed for 76 before Azam came to the crease.

title: Texas plane crash: Massive fire erupts as multiple trucks hit near in Fort Worth; 2 dead
content: Tragedy struck near Hicks Airfield in Texas as a small plane crashed, claiming at least two lives. The aircraft impacted several trucks, igniting a significant fire that emergency crews worked to control. Investigations by the FAA and NTSB are anticipated to determine the cause of this devastating incident.

title: France’s political turmoil: PM Sebastien Lecornu unveils new cabinet
content: France's Prime Minister Sebastien Lecornu has unveiled a new Cabinet, blending centrist, conservative, and external figures. Facing immediate challenges like budget creation and investor confidence, the government must navigate a fractured parliament. Key appointments include a new defense minister for Ukraine support and an interior minister for security, as France grapples with political turmoil and calls for new elections.

title: Connor McDavid crowned NHL’s fastest player, proves Oilers’ contract right
content: Connor McDavid has once again proven his status as the NHL's best, reaching a season-high skating speed of 39.61 km/h. This incredible pace, combined with his skill and hockey IQ, makes him a constant threat. His recent performance, including an assist on an empty-net goal, highlights his value, validating the Oilers' smart contract decision to keep him with the team.

title: Beaten during class, 2 teens killed cleric’s wife, daughters for revenge
content: Tragedy struck a mosque in Meerut as two teenage students, aged 14 and 16, allegedly murdered the cleric's wife and two young daughters. Driven by revenge for perceived mistreatment during religious lessons, the boys confessed to using a knife and hammer. Police swiftly apprehended the juveniles, cracking the case within hours.

title: ‘Evening of tears, joy’: Netanyahu accepts war mismanagement; IDF launches Op ‘Returning Home’
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu acknowledged divisions over a Gaza ceasefire deal, urging national unity as hostages are set to return. He described the moment as a mix of sorrow for prisoner exchanges and joy for the hostages' homecoming.  The IDF launched 'Operation Returning Home' after two years of pressure, emphasizing ongoing security challenges.

title: Cam Newton’s kids: Meet his 9 children and their three mothers
content: Former NFL quarterback Cam Newton has welcomed his ninth child, a son with girlfriend Jasmin Brown. Newton, who also has two children with Brown and four with ex-girlfriend Kia Proctor, emphasizes love and accountability in his large family. Despite post-NFL challenges, his children remain his greatest source of strength and purpose.

title: Madhya Pradesh: 8 Bangladeshi nationals held for living illegally for 12 years
content: Eight suspected Bangladeshi nationals, residing illegally in Gwalior for over 12 years, were arrested near a high-security Air Force base. The operation followed the detention of their relatives in Haryana. The family admitted to illegally crossing into India and working as laborers, raising significant security concerns.

title: How one Trump call convinced Hamas to take Gaza peace deal seriously
content: A September Israeli bombing in Doha nearly derailed Gaza peace talks, prompting Qatar to threaten withdrawal. However, a direct intervention by Donald Trump, including a phone call between Netanyahu and Qatar's PM, salvaged the negotiations. This moment convinced Hamas of Trump's ability to influence Israel, paving the way for a significant ceasefire.

title: Dwyane Wade signs Russian star Egor Demin to expand his Way of Wade empire
content: NBA legend Dwyane Wade's Way of Wade brand is expanding globally by signing teenage sensation Egor Demin. This strategic move, a joint venture with Li-Ning, targets the Chinese and Russian markets, showcasing Wade's commitment to international growth and fostering new talent. The partnership emphasizes innovation and courage, marking an exciting new chapter for the brand.

title: 'Prez Xi had a bad moment': Trump says US wants to 'help' China — will he ease tariff threat?
content: US President Donald Trump softened his stance on China, calling President Xi "highly respected" and claiming the US wants to help, not harm, China. This came days after Trump accused Beijing of hostile actions over rare earth exports and threatened steep tariffs. China defended its controls, warning against escalation. VP JD Vance backed Trump’s tough approach while leaving room for negotiation.

title: US-China trade war: When Trump's tariff push met Beijing’s counterpunch; key points explained
content: US-China trade tensions have reignited with Beijing imposing rare earth export curbs, sparking retaliation from Washington. China accuses the US of unfair practices, while the US criticizes China's actions as hostile. Both nations are now using export controls as leverage ahead of upcoming talks, potentially reshaping global supply chains and testing diplomatic limits.

title: WC: World record! Australia creates history in Vizag with 3-wicket win over India
content: Alyssa Healy's brilliant 142 powered Australia to a record 331-run chase against India, securing a historic three-wicket win.  Despite strong half-centuries from Smriti Mandhana and Pratika Rawal, India's total wasn't enough.  Healy's exceptional innings, supported by Ashleigh Gardner and a returning Ellyse Perry, sealed the victory for the unbeaten Australians.

title: The voting patterns of Muslims in Seemanchal
content: Muslims in Seemanchal are broadly divided into three castes — the Surjapuri, Shershahbadi and Kulhaiya castes. Although the differences between them are not very obvious to an outsider, these three caste groups differ culturally

title: Vizag will become State’s financial capital, says IT Minister Lokesh
content: It has taken 30 years for Hyderabad to develop, but Visakhapatnamwill not take more than10 years, he asserts, and insists that the city will be a trillion dollar economy by 2047

title: Bihar election LIVE: NDA seals seat-sharing formula; BJP, JDU to contest 101 seats each, LJP (Ram Vilas) gets 29 seats
content: The Mahagathbandhan (grand alliance) leaders will meet in Delhi to finalise the seat-sharing deal for the Bihar Assembly election on Monday

title: Residents, activists raise questions over renaming of streets in Chennai
content: Activists say that it would be time consuming to change addresses on various identity cards; many queries are yet to be answered, they say

title: Congress alleges government of increasingly restricting citizens’ access to RTI in Tripura
content: Saha told presspersons that the BJP govt has increasingly restricted citizens’ access to information over the past 11 years and also undermined the effectiveness of Right to Information Commissions at the State level.

title: India to host U.N. troop contributing countries' chiefs conclave from Oct 14-16
content: The UNTCC serves as a vital forum to address operational challenges, evolving threats, interoperability, inclusivity in decision-making and the role of technology and training in strengthening UN peacekeeping.

title: Gurugram gets India’s first QR-based challan payment kiosk
content: Each unit will be equipped with beacon lights for visibility, and allow citizens to connect via video call to report emergencies or request help at the press of a button.

title: Death of 3 minors in a month rattles Meghalaya
content: A juvenile was held after the mysterious death of a four-year-old girl in Shillong, while a 22-year-old man was arrested for the alleged rape and murder of a 13-year-old girl in the Ri-Bhoi district

title: Congress reaches out to alliance partners over Bills to remove PM, CMs, Ministers
content: The three Bills deal with the procedure to remove the Prime Minister, Chief Ministers, and Ministers if they are arrested on serious criminal charges for 30 days

title: Haryana IPS officer death: Stalemate over autopsy continues; 48-hour ultimatum to remove DGP
content: The officer's family has refused to give its consent for a post-mortem examination and cremation of the body until its demands are addressed.

title: T.N. Minister inaugurates Fire and Rescue station for Arunachaleswarar temple
content: TNFRS officials said that it was a fire accident that gutted over 30 shops along the East Tower side of the Sri Meenakshi Sundareswarar Temple in Madurai in February 2018 that mooted the idea of setting up fire and rescue stations meant exclusively for historical temples in the State.

title: CSIR- SERC develops technology to reduce construction time; demonstrates indigenous Threaded End Anchor system
content: This anchor system addresses one of the long – time challenges in reinforced concrete construction, which is reinforcement congestion, and the resultant need for lengthy anchorage requirements.

title: Vijayawada’s first heritage walk evokes good response
content: The participants, especially the younger lot, listened in attention as INTACH volunteers explained to them about the significance of each site

title: Karur stampede case: DMK sees bid to mislead Supreme Court
content: One petition seems to have been filed in the name of a person not truly representative of the deceased and the other by a person who seems to have been misled into signing documents he did not fully understand, says DMK organisation secretary R.S. Bharathi

title: Great Amaravati Shopping Festival a perfect platform to cash in on GST reforms, says Collector
content: Being organised from October 13 to 19 at Punnami Ghat-Berm Park in Vijayawada, the festival offers businesses, budding entrepreneurs, and artisans to set up stalls and promote their brands, says Lakshmisha

title: Pact with Google on Vizag data centre will be signed in Delhi on October 14, says Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu
content: The 1 GW facility will transform the Port City into a global data hub and give a fillip to the government’s initiatives in Artificial Intelligence

title: Environment Minister heads to Brazil for key pre-COP talks
content: COP30 is set to take place against a complex geopolitical backdrop, with the United States withdrawing from the Paris Agreement and several developed countries reassessing their climate strategies

title: Haryana Cabinet approves ordinance to decriminalise minor offences
content: The ordinance replaces criminal penalties for minor technical and procedural lapses with civil penalties and administrative actions

title: Canadian Foreign Minister Anita Anand arrives in Delhi, set to meet Jaishankar on October 13
content: In New Delhi, Minister Anand will meet with Mr. Jaishankar and Mr. Goyal, as “both countries move toward establishing a framework for strategic cooperation

title: Operation Blue Star: BJP, SGPC take dig at Congress after Chidambaram remarks
content: BJP spokesperson R.P. Singh says the operation was completely avoidable, as rightly mentioned by former Home Minister Chidambaram

title: Man forced to wash Brahmin man’s feet, drink water over ‘objectionable’ AI image in Madhya Pradesh, four booked
content: A video of the alleged incident has also appeared on social media showing the victim surrounded by locals, who were instructing him to perform the act and apologise, washing a man’s feet

title: Andhra Pradesh Chief Minister rolls out Excise Suraksha app, sets up SIT
content: The app enables consumers to check liquor quality, while a Special Investigation Team investigates the Mulakalacheruvu spurious liquor racket

title: Lack of dog catchers hits district panchayat’s sterilisation programme
content: Despite having the capacity to sterilise over 100 dogs every month, the two ABC centres in Mulanthuruthy and Vadavucode block panchayats are unable to meet the target

title: Grand alliance to finalise Bihar seat-sharing on October 13; Rahul Gandhi may meet Tejashwi
content: Vikassheel Insaan Party chief Mukesh Sahani says the alliance is “unwell” and that all the “doctors” are sitting in Delhi; Congress says it will fight on a “respectable and acceptable” number of seats

title: National and strategic interests are supreme, says Saharanpur MP Imran Masood
content: The Congress leader’s remarks follow a visit by the Afghan Taliban administration’s Foreign Minister Amir Khan Muttaqi to the Darul Uloom Deoband in Saharanpur

title: Email accounts of 12 lakh Central government employees now run on Zoho’s platform
content: The accounts were migrated from a National Informatics Centre-based system; senior official says Zoho’s suite has been activated to ensure that government employees do not use open source applications; the move to switch to Zoho’s platform ‘empowers India to lead with home-grown innovation’, the Centre says

title: Israel-Gaza Ceasefire Live Updates: Israel Launches Operation 'Returning Home' To Free Hostages Held By Hamas
content: The Israel Defense Forces (IDF) announced the launch of Operation "Returning Home," aimed at bringing back hostages held by Hamas in Gaza.

title: Israel, Hamas To Begin Hostage-Prisoner Swap, Trump Says "Gaza War Over"
content: Israel and Hamas are set to begin a hostage-prisoner swap in their breakthrough ceasefire deal, with US President Donald Trump declaring that the war is "over".

title: 2 RJD MLAs Resign From Assembly Ahead Of Bihar Polls, May Join JDU
content: Two RJD MLAs - Vibha Devi and Prakash Veer - resigned from the assembly on Sunday, amid speculations that they could join Chief Minister Nitish Kumar's JD(U) ahead of the Bihar elections.

title: Tripura Man 'Rapes, Murders' 14-Month-Old, Arrested
content: A 14-month-old child was allegedly raped and killed in North Tripura's Panisagar area, police said on Sunday.

title: 32 Cases Against Hair Stylist Jawed Habib In UP Over 'Defrauding' Investors
content: As many as 32 FIRs have been registered against celebrity hairstylist Jawed Habib, his son Anos Habib and another person for allegedly defrauding investors by promising high returns.

title: Suspected Pak Woman, Who Escaped From Nepal Jail, Arrested In Tripura
content: A 65-year-old woman suspected to be a Pakistani national involved in drug trafficking and a jailbreaker from Nepal was arrested from the border town of Sabroom in South Tripura district.

title: 'If Peace Fails, We Have Other Means': Taliban Minister On Pak Conflict
content: Afghanistan wants a peaceful resolution of its ongoing conflict with Pakistan, but if the peace efforts don't succeed, then it has "other means", Afghan Foreign Minister Amir Khan Muttaqi said

title: 2 Takeaways From NDA Bihar Plan: JDU-BJP Power Balance, Chirag Paswan Factor
content: The NDA has finally announced its seat sharing for the 2025 Bihar Assembly elections, and the formula it has come up with could mark a new political balance in the state.

title: Maharashtra Man Charged For Raping Woman On Pretext Of Curing Evil Spirits
content: A man was booked in Maharashtra's Raigad district for allegedly raping a woman after promising to "cure' her of evil spirits, a police official said on Sunday.

title: Student, 18, Found Dead In Rajasthan Hotel Room; Probe Underway: Cops
content: A student of Class 12, missing for two days, was found dead in a hotel room here, police said on Sunday.

title: Israel To Sit Out Gaza Peace Summit Hosted By Trump And Egypt's Sisi
content: Israel will not send a representative to the peace summit for Gaza that will be hosted by US President Donald Trump and his Egyptian counterpart, Abdel Fattah al-Sisi, on Monday in Sharm el-Sheikh.

title: Zelensky Warns Russia Of Exploiting Lack Of 'Attention' On War
content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky lobbied his allies for more air defences, warning that Russia was "taking advantage" of attention shifting away from the Ukraine war to intensify its bombardment of the country.

title: Trump Says US 'Wants To Help China, Not Hurt It', Days After Tariff Threat
content: President Donald Trump said the United States wants to help China, not hurt it, striking a conciliatory tone days after threatening an additional 100 per cent tariff on the world's second-largest economy.

title: Taliban Says Pakistan Military Faction 'Sabotaging Peace', Warns Of Retaliation
content: The Taliban government has accused a powerful faction within Pakistan's military of orchestrating a campaign of hostility and misinformation aimed at destabilising Afghanistan and diverting attention from Islamabad's internal chaos.

title: "Any Moment Now": US Says Hamas To Free Remaining Israeli Hostages Soon
content: The release of the remaining Israeli hostages held by Hamas is imminent, US Vice President JD Vance said Sunday, while vowing that the Trump administration would apply all necessary pressure to ensure future stability in Gaza.

title: 5 Meetings In 3 Months Spark Raj-Uddhav Thackeray Alliance Buzz
content: Political circles in Maharashtra have been abuzz with the growing proximity between Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) chief Raj Thackeray and Shiv Sena (UBT) chief Uddhav Thackeray.

title: 3 Accused In Bengal Gang Rape Case Sent To 10-Day Police Custody
content: A subdivisional court here on Sunday remanded to 10-day police custody the three men arrested for their alleged involvement in the "gangrape" of a student of a private medical college in West Bengal's Paschim Bardhaman district.

title: After Omar Abdullah's Snub, Congress' "No" To Rajya Sabha Polls In J&K
content: The Congress has decided not field a candidate for the Rajya Sabha elections in Jammu and Kashmir, accusing alliance partner National Conference of ignoring their request for a "safe seat".

title: UP Woman Injured As Old Firecrackers Drying On House Roof Explode
content: A woman was severely injured in an explosion caused by old firecrackers at a house in Khatuli town of Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar, police said.

title: Legislating Deepfakes, AI-Enabled Child Abuse Need Of Hour: Top Court Judge
content: Supreme Court judge Justice B V Nagarathna stressed that the need of the hour is for the competent authorities to look into legislating deepfakes and artificial intelligence-enabled child abuse.

title: 'Free thinking under attack in India': Rahul to students in Chile
content: Rahul Gandhi, speaking abroad, voiced concerns that free and scientific thinking faces a significant challenge in India. He emphasized the need for an inclusive education system fostering curiosity and critical thought, calling it the bedrock of freedom. These remarks follow his earlier critique of India's democracy, drawing sharp criticism from the BJP.

title: 'I just want my wife': Mark Sanchez out of hospital, jail after violent stabbing
content: Former NFL star Mark Sanchez is recovering after a violent incident in Indianapolis. The ex-Jets quarterback was stabbed during a dispute. He faced multiple charges including battery and public intoxication. Sanchez has been released from custody and is focusing on his recovery. He thanked medical staff for saving his life. Legal proceedings are set to continue in November.

title: Durand fault line: Pak's Taliban gamble has backfired - why it struggles to contain TTP
content: Afghanistan and Pakistan face renewed conflict along their volatile border. Deadly clashes erupted after Kabul accused Islamabad of bombing its territory. Pakistan claims Afghan forces attacked first. The Durand Line, a disputed border, is the flashpoint. Tensions have disrupted trade and raised regional alarm. Afghanistan denies harboring Pakistani militants, calling it an internal Pakistani issue.

title: CPI(M), Congress likely to seek more seats in 2026
content: We have identified the constituencies where we will campaign. Other parties are carrying out a State-wide campaign to come to power. But we contest only in a few constituencies as part of an alliance. So, there is no need for a State-wide campaign for us, says the party State secretary

title: Man from Tamil Nadu gets new lease of life at Kozhikode MCH
content: Prashanth, 32, of Tirupathur met with a road accident in Kozhikode while travelling to Sabarimala from Kannur

title: Sharmila accuses NDA government of weakening RTI Act on its 20th anniversary
content: She demands repeal of 2019 amendments, restoration of tenure and autonomy for Information Commissions

title: Mahatma Gandhi’s method remains profoundly relevant today: Bhikhu Parekh
content: Gandhiji reminds us to look through another’s eyes, says the member of the House of Lords in the U.K. and a political thinker; he says the recognition of the state of Palestine by Britain gives symbolic legitimacy but imposes no real obligations; he describes Prime Minister Narendra Modi as capable and competent, but greatness requires more, especially in addressing India’s structural flaws.

title: Tej Pratap Yadav unfollows Tejashwi Yadav on ‘X’, signalling widening RJD family rift
content: Ahead of Bihar Assembly elections, the elder Yadav scion distances himself from his younger brother and the party leadership, while forging alliances for his new political venture

title: Will not discuss alliance expectations in public: Selvaperunthagai
content: He says he will communicate State unit’s expectations to the All India Congress Committee and the DMK leadership

title: Attack on Telugu devotee in Tiruvannamalai sparks concern in Tirupati
content: Political analysts and social activists warn that rising Tamil‑Telugu tensions could strain inter‑State relations and local trade, urging that temples stay above politics

title: Commuters demand urgent repair of Hennur–Bagalur road linking Bengaluru airport
content: Commuters have argued that if repaired properly, the road could serve airport-bound traffic by cutting down travel time, fuel consumption, and congestion on the main highway leading to the airport

title: Government to file SLP in the Supreme Court over over 42% BC quota in local body polls
content: The government is confident that it has complied with all the conditions laid down by the Supreme Court in earlier judgments concerning reservations for BCs in local bodies

title: We are not building palaces, but bringing investments, says Andhra Pradesh IT Minister Lokesh
content: Defending allocation of prime land for IT giants for a low price, he says, of the investment agreements worth approximately 120 billion dollars signed so far, nearly 50% are focused on the Greater Visakhapatnam Economic Region

title: SIT probe into ‘misappropriation’ of Sabarimala Ayyappa temple artefacts expands to other States
content: A squad is in Chennai to interview the factory management contracted by Unnikrishnan Potti, the prime accused, to restore the gold-plated panels. Officials say the SIT may probe Potti’s antecedents in Bengaluru and Hyderabad.

title: India sends Minister to Egypt for Gaza summit
content: New Delhi will be represented by Minister of State for External Affairs Kirtivardhan Singh in place of Prime Minister Narendra Modi, who declined the invitation from Egypt due to the short notice

title: NDA finalises seat-sharing pact for Bihar election; BJP and JD(U) get 101 seats each
content: Smaller allies Chirag Paswan, Jitan Ram Manjhi, and Upendra Kushwaha allocated 29 and six seats each as alliance leaders project unity ahead of Assembly election

title: YSRCP to stage Statewide protests against spurious liquor trade on October 13
content: Party targets coalition government and TDP leaders, demands CBI probe, stricter Excise inspections, and support for families affected by toxic alcohol deaths

title: Chennai’s retail market sees 8% YoY growth in Q3 2025
content: Main streets dominated leasing activity with an 88% share, recording 0.14 million square feet of leasing - up 29% over the previous quarter, according to a report

title: NDA government will make Vizag financial capital of Andhra Pradesh, says IT Minister Lokesh
content: It has taken 30 years for Hyderabad to develop, but Visakhapatnam will not take more than 10 years, says Lokesh, and insists that the city will be a trillion dollar economy by 2047

title: Azhikodan Achamthuruthi team wins Kozhikode leg of Champion’s Boat League
content: While Palichom Achamthuruthi team bagged the second prize, AKG Podothuruthi A Team bagged the third prize in the championship that was witnessed by a massive crowd that assembled on both the banks of the river Chaliyar

title: Farmers plan to picket sugar factory in Gadag
content: ‘Farmers are stakeholders of the sugar factory and the factory management is duty bound to inform us about crushing’

title: CESL gears up to drive hydrogen bus revolution across India
content: Agency will focus on Hyderabad, Warangal, Mahabubnagar, Khammam to promote clean mobility in Telangana

title: Priyank Kharge asks CM to ban RSS activities on govt. facilities/sites, CM recommends immediate action
content: IT and BT, Rural Development and Panchayat Raj Minister Priyank Kharge has demanded that Chief Minister Siddaramaiah impose a ban on all Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh activities in government institutions and on public premises across Karnataka, stating that such actions are contrary to India’s unity and the spirit of the Constitution

title: Thalassemia patients flag shortage of leukocyte filter sets, iron chelation drugs
content: Even after blood transfusion, haemoglobin level among a section of thalassemia patients in Kerala is dipping. Also, the large amount of iron deposited in the body after blood transfusion harms internal organs since iron chelation drugs are in short supply

title: Same alliances, static caste arithmetic, but Bihar battle can upend status quo
content: The biggest worry of the NDA is Nitish Kumar’s health and whether or not he can continue as Chief Minister for a full term if the alliance wins; the grand alliance has to contend with poor governance record of RJD when it was in power; both fronts anxious about the impact of new player JSP

title: Keep fighting for preservation of Kottooli wetlands: Sandeep Pandey
content: The protection of wetlands is more the responsibility of local bodies than of the State or Central governments, says the activist

title: Minister says Election Commission not taking action against Vote Chori
content: It has power to do so as an independent autonomous institution, according to Sharanabasappa Darshnapur

title: Call to establish Balaji railway division in Tirupati gets louder
content: The idea of a new division developed in the 1990s, however, remains a non-starter due to political disinterest, as the issue has been neglected during successive regimes

title: Minor, infant shifted to shelter home in Kozhikode
content: The move is part of the legal and protective measures initiated for the two after the alleged sexual abuse of the minor girl came to light when she recently delivered the baby, say police

title: Kerala Women Entrepreneurs’ Conclave 2025 to be held
content: Event aims to accelerate women’s participation in entrepreneurship and promote technology-driven business ventures in State

title: ‘Suspicion can’t replace proof’: SC raps Uttarakhand HC; frees 3 convicted in 2007 case
content: A journalist based in Dehradun, Uttarakhand with over 18 years of experience. Currently working as Principal Correspondent in TOI. I cover archaeology, industry and judiciary (High Court, NGT, Consumer Commission and tribunals). Read More

title: 540 Indian nationals in Nepal prisons absconding since Gen Z protests
content: more than 13,000 prisoners escaped from various jails of Nepal during the second day of anti-government protests on september 9 . at least 5,000 Nepali citizens are still absconding, followed by 540 Indian nationals and 108 prisoners of other nations .

title: After being released on bail, Azam Khan gets Y-category security back
content: Y-category security was withdrawn after his conviction by a court and disqualification from the state assembly . he walked out of Sitapur district jail on september 23 on bail . security personnel and gunners assigned to Khan resume duty .

title: Jubilee Hills notification today
content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . first day first show news and reviews from the world of cinema and streaming . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in!

title: Unregulated export of 'toxic syrups' a risk, warns WHO
content: Pearl D’Souza is a principal correspondent at The Times of India, having dedicated nine years to journalism. She covers health, along with a wide range of other topics. She is particularly focused on the rapidly evolving health sector, with special emphasis on public health infrastructure. Her reporting spans education, science, and technology, food. She was certified as a Climate Correspondent by the Fulbright-Hays Public Diplomacy Program, organized by the US Mission India in 2024, and is a 2025 candidate for United Nation's RAF memorial journalism fellowship. Read More

title: ‘You’re embracing Taliban’: Mehbooba Mufti slams BJP over ‘land jihad’ charge
content: mehbooba mufti accused BJP of engaging with the same Taliban it once branded terrorists . she said BJP once wanted to lock Darul Uloom Deoband, now takes Afghan ministers there to shower them with flowers .

title: P Chidambaram's 'Op Blue Star a mistake' puts Congress in a tight spot
content: IP Singh is Senior Assistant Editor at The Times of India. He covers news in Jalandhar and neighbouring districts, and writes on politics, contemporary trends, Punjabi diaspora and heritage preservation. He specializes in deciphering religio-political peculiarities and complexities of Punjab. His hobbies include reading up on a variety of subjects. Read More

title: I'm dismayed Noel didn't back me as Tata Sons director: Mehli
content: Reeba Zachariah is assistant corporate editor at The Times of India, Mumbai. She has been covering large Indian business houses such as the Tata Group. She also reports on a host of sectors like hospitality, retail, travel, liquor and consumer durables. She has been writing on mergers and  acquisitions and private equity. title: Tougher charge, punishable with life term, added to IPS suicide case
content: Ajay Sura is Senior Assistant Editor with The Times of India Chandigarh. He covers news concerning the State of Haryana, Punjab & Haryana High Court and Defence & Military Affairs. He likes to analyse political developments and decoding judicial pronouncements. His hobbies include travelling, mountaineering and trekking. Read More

title: 4 cousins die as car hits parked road-roller in Haryana
content:
Representative image

ROHTAK: Four cousins died after their car crashed into a road-roller parked on the roadside near Gohana, along Delhi-Jammu NH-44, in Haryana’s Sonipat district on Saturday. Among the deceased was Somveer, son of Congress Rohtak (rural) president Balwan Ranga. The others were his cousins, Ankit, Lokesh and Deepankar. Police said the car spiralled out of control and crashed into the road-roller just 15km short of their village. They were returning from a meeting related to their tiles business, Congress urban district president Kuldeep KD said. Sarpanch Anil accused NHAI of negligence, alleging that no warning signs had been placed at the construction site.

End of Article

title: Ahead of Supreme Court order, Delhi split on green crackers
content: Kushagra Dixit writes on environmental issues, wildlife conservation, climate change, agriculture,  human rights, and scientific research. His investigative coverage encompasses river contamination with emphasis on the Yamuna, air pollution, urban waste and their collective effects on public wellbeing. Read More

title: Didi blames college for letting rape survivor step out at night
content: CM Mamata Banerjee: "how did they (the girl and a male friend) come out of the campus at 12.30 am? wasn't it the responsibility of the college? I don't know why they were allowed to leave at that hour" she says it's not possible for cops to be present everywhere at all times of the day . she urges students from other states to be "careful and not venture out of campuses late at night"

title: First-time parity: NDA allies BJP & JD(U) to fight 101 Bihar seats each
content: the rest 12 out of 243 seats have been equally split between HAM and RLM . this is the first time BJP and JD(U) are contesting an equal number of seats . BJP's central brass didn’t agree to the insistence of a strong section in its state unit that it claim the first-among-the equal status .

title: Muttaqi cancels Taj Mahal visit, no reasons assigned
content: Sudeep Lavania is a Digital Content Producer with Times of India. An engineer by degree, he has a deep interest in defence, international relations and railways. In his free time, he likes to go on bike rides. Before coming to Times of India, Sudeep served for 2 years in India Today Digital as a Sub-Editor at their news desk. Read More

title: Yunus: Given a choice, India will continue to host Hasina
content: 'some external forces' want ex-PM of Bangladesh to return home . the Nobel laureate says the interim govt is "very alert" about communal harmony . he dismisses "fake news" reports of attacks against the minority Hindu community .

title: Centre has no plan to raise ‘creamy layer’ income cap
content: the last revision took place eight years ago and is now twice overdue . there is at present an annual income bar of Rs 8 lakh for the purpose . an OBC family that earns more than the prescribed ceiling is ineligible for quotas in public education and employment .

title: PM Modi invited to Gaza summit, MoS to attend
content: the invitation from the white house and Egyptian authorities was delivered on Saturday . EAM S Jaishankar has bilateral talks with his Canadian counterpart Anita Anand . both leaders will co-chair the peace summit in the resort city of Sharm El-Sheikh .

title: Way-Too-Early WNBA Power Rankings: Early look at 2026
content: the Las Vegas Aces are the 2025 champions after a WNBA Finals sweep over the Phoenix Mercury . this offseason will be the busiest in league history . a new collective bargaining agreement is needed, plus expansion drafts for two new franchises .

title: Pakistan fumes as Taliban back India’s sovereignty over J&K
content: the Taliban have backed India’s sovereignty over Jammu & Kashmir (J&K) the joint statement was issued after external affairs minister S Jaishankar’s meeting with Afghan foreign minister Amir Khan Muttaqi . Pakistan sees Afghanistan as opening a new front in the strained relationship .

title: AP Week 7 poll reaction: What's next for each Top 25 team
content: the top two teams in the poll stayed steady but there was movement not far below . then-no. 7 Indiana went to then no. 3 Oregon and notched a big win to declare themselves as legitimate national title contenders . Alabama and Ole Miss squeaked out wins . now they are atop the SEC alongside Texas A&M .

title: Projecting the CFP top 12 at midseason: Buckeyes the team to beat
content: Ohio State has emerged as the clear favorite in "SportsCenter" at the midpoint of the season, Penn State has three losses . Texas is trying to claw its way back into the playoff conversation, and undefeated Indiana is a top five team . the battle for no. 1 is ongoing .

title: Brewers or Dodgers? Blue Jays or Mariners? What final four must do to reach Fall Classic
content: the 2025 league championship series is set for a trip to the world series on the line . the next day, the defending champion Los Angeles Dodgers and top-seeded Milwaukee Brewers will begin their series on a national league side of the bracket .

title: Best of Week 7: Indiana is a genuine power on the national stage
content: college football has been defined by what's new in college football . it has been nearly three decades since we've had a first-time national champion . the biggest brands have continued to dominate the sport . there's the transfer portal, NIL money, revenue sharing, revamped rosters, realignment .

title: How much longer can the Phillies keep contending?
content: the final play of the national league division series against the los Angeles Dodgers will live in your nightmares for a long time . the Phillies were eliminated in Game 4 of the NLDS . there were two other short throws from Game 2 that might have impacted the outcome of the series .

title: Falcons and Bills throwbacks, Commanders' all-black top NFL Week 6 threads
content: the Atlanta Falcons are rocking their throwback uniforms against the Buffalo Bills . the iconic helmet was reintroduced in 2022 with the old school Falcons logo . in the second game of a "Monday Night Football" doubleheader, the Washington Commanders are wearing their all-black alternates against a Chicago Bears game .

title: WWE Crown Jewel takeaways: Cena, Styles pass the torch to Rollins, Rhodes
content: the match between two retiring legends at the end of this year and Styles in 2026 featured an impressive amount of tributes to past opponents and WWE legends . only The Undertaker has more with 107, a record we will have to wait a while to see broken .

title: College football betting: Who are the top title contenders? Look to the trenches
content: the best teams in the country aren't quarterback-driven, they are line-driven . the top teams are Ohio State , Indiana , Texas Tech , Miami and Texas A&M . five of those six are undefeated .

title: Penn State fires Franklin amid midseason free fall
content: sources say the school has fired coach James Franklin after 12 seasons . it's the second-biggest buyout in college football history behind only Jimbo Fisher's $76 million buyout from Texas A&M . no other staff changes are expected at Penn State, a source says .

title: Mahomes, Brown connect twice as Chiefs cruise to win over Lions
content: Sunday's NFL Week 6 action kicked off early in London, with the  New York Jets  facing the  Denver Broncos  at Tottenham Hotspur Stadium in the league's third straight international game. Bo Nix  threw an early touchdown pass,  Wil Lutz  kicked a late go-ahead field goal and the Broncos (4-2) sacked  Justin Fields  nine times, with the final one sealing  a 13-11 win  against the Jets (0-6). Baker Mayfield  led the injury-depleted  Tampa Bay Buccaneers  past the  San Francisco 49ers , who lost  Fred Warner  to injury, and the  Seattle Seahawks  beat the  Jacksonville Jaguars . The  Carolina Panthers  beat the  Dallas Cowboys  behind big games from  Rico Dowdle 's 183 rushing yards and  Tetairoa McMillan 's two touchdowns. Follow along here for real-time highlights, analysis and key moments from Sunday's games:

title: 🤠 'So long, partner': Panthers top Week 6 trolls
content: the Panthers beat the Dallas Cowboys 30-27 after a last-second 33-yard field goal from kicker Ryan Fitzgerald . the three points capped off a 15-play, 71-yard drive from Carolina, which is 3-3 through its first six games for the first time since 2021 .
